headline: 9-year-old Kingston gets love from Bengals players, Mike Brown, Gov. DeWine
author: WLWT Digital Staff
sentences: Erica Thomas, Kingston's mom, tells us Kingston had an amazing experience and they're thanking the Bengals and front office for making it possible to witness the team in the 2022 Super Bowl.
"The feeling of being a mother seeing the joy in your son and the people running up to Kingston getting to know him through these stories has been incredible."
"They'll spot King and just throw up a high five or do some sort of sign that we see you, we're here for you, just the way that you're here for us," she said.
Before that, Kingston has gotten souvenirs from games, towels and footballs from players like Ja'Marr Chase, Joe Burrow and Joe Mixon.
The 9-year-old super fan has attended every home game and playoff game and left most of them with gifts from players.

CINCINNATI —
The Bengals' smallest super fan has a lot to be thankful for following the team's incredible season.
Kingston was surprised with Super Bowl tickets at the Bengals pep rally held at Paul Brown Stadium.
He also got a sleeve from Mike Hilton and gloves from Jermaine Pratt to add to his collection.
Not many kids can say the Bengals players, the owner and the governor are rooting for you.
She believes the players see some of themselves in her son and that he has inspired them.
He came home with a ball signed by Evan McPherson, CJ Uzomah, Mike Hilton and Eli Apple.
During a rally on Monday to honor the Cincinnati Bengals, King also met Ohio Gov.
Kingston's mom, Erica Thomas, said the season has been full of amazing moments.
Hilton had tears streaming down his face, and Kingston had tears in his eyes.
In Kansas City, Kingston took pre-game selfies with players like Joe Mixon.
She is overwhelmed by how the players have taken her son under their wing.
After the game, he took celebratory selfies with players like Mike Hilton.
Kingston Thomas' mom shared photos of her and Kingston at the Super Bowl.
Kingston may be the luckiest Bengals fan in Who Dey Nation this season.
She says — no matter the outcome — they love their team.
Kingston cheered the Bengals on to a win in Nashville.
Fans and many of the players now know him by name.
Mike DeWine and Bengals owner Mike Brown.
"He was like 'You're at all the games.
We said 'Yes,'" Kingston Thomas said.
Aren't you?'
